alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Cimarron; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 23 at 4:09AM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW POSSIBLE ACROSS THE OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE AND NORTHERN TEXAS PANHANDLE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT... An upper level storm system is expected to move across southern Colorado and western Kansas Friday night into Saturday night. Snow is expected across much of the Panhandles Friday night into Saturday night. It is too early to tell the exact amount of snow that may fall, but the Oklahoma Panhandle and the northern Texas Panhandle seem to have the best chance at seeing accumulating snowfall. The snow may cause low visibility at times and could cause roads to become slick and hazardous. Motorists should exercise caution, be prepared for rapidly changing visibilities and slick spots on roadways. Allow for extra time to reach your destination. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.844.465.4997 for Oklahoma and 1.800.452.9292 for Texas, or visit oklahoma.gov/odot.html for Oklahoma and txdot.gov for Texas.
